meanings.definition: Skas (noun): A style of music that originated in Jamaica in the 1960s.
meanings.sent1: The band played energetic skas at the concert.
meanings.sent2: I love listening to skas while relaxing.
meanings.sent3: The skas music made everyone dance joyfully.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed like skas through the room.
meanings.sent5: The skas melodies lingered in the air long after the performance.

meanings.definition: Skas (verb): To move quickly or hastily.
meanings.sent1: I need to skas to catch the bus on time.
meanings.sent2: The cat skas across the room to catch the toy.
meanings.sent3: He had to skas to finish his homework before dinner.
meanings.sent4: Time skas by when you're having fun.
meanings.sent5: The wind skas through the trees, rustling the leaves.

meanings.definition: Skas (adjective): Describing something that is cool or stylish.
meanings.sent1: She wore a skas outfit to the party.
meanings.sent2: The new phone design is really skas.
meanings.sent3: His skateboard tricks were totally skas.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence shone like a skas diamond.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky in skas hues of orange and pink.
